commit.message:
libgcj.spec.in (jc1): Add EXCEPTIONSPEC.

2001-04-30  Andrew Haley  <aph@cambridge.redhat.com>

        * libgcj.spec.in (jc1): Add EXCEPTIONSPEC.
        * configure.host (EXCEPTIONSPEC): New.
        * configure.in (EXCEPTIONSPEC): New.
        * configure: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r41733

files.patch:
@@ -5092,6 +5092,7 @@ fi
 
 
 
+
 if test "$CANADIAN" = yes; then
   CANADIAN_TRUE=
   CANADIAN_FALSE='#'
@@ -5150,18 +5151,18 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for g++ -ffloat-store bug""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5154: checking for g++ -ffloat-store bug" >&5
+echo "configure:5155: checking for g++ -ffloat-store bug" >&5
 save_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
 CFLAGS="-x c++ -O2 -ffloat-store"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5158 "configure"
+#line 5159 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <math.h>
 int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5165: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5166: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   echo "$ac_t""no" 1>&6
 else
@@ -5181,17 +5182,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h bstring.h sys/time.h sys/types.h fcntl.h sys/ioctl.h sys/
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5185: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:5186: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5190 "configure"
+#line 5191 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:5195: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:5196: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -5221,17 +5222,17 @@ for ac_hdr in dirent.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5225: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:5226: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5230 "configure"
+#line 5231 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:5235: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:5236: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -5259,20 +5260,20 @@ done
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for ANSI C header files""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5263: checking for ANSI C header files" >&5
+echo "configure:5264: checking for ANSI C header files" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_stdc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5268 "configure"
+#line 5269 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <stdarg.h>
 #include <string.h>
 #include <float.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:5276: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:5277: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -5289,7 +5290,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
   # SunOS 4.x string.h does not declare mem*, contrary to ANSI.
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5293 "configure"
+#line 5294 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <string.h>
 EOF
@@ -5307,7 +5308,7 @@ fi
 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
   # ISC 2.0.2 stdlib.h does not declare free, contrary to ANSI.
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5311 "configure"
+#line 5312 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 EOF
@@ -5328,7 +5329,7 @@ if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   :
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5332 "configure"
+#line 5333 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <ctype.h>
 #define ISLOWER(c) ('a' <= (c) && (c) <= 'z')
@@ -5339,7 +5340,7 @@ if (XOR (islower (i), ISLOWER (i)) || toupper (i) != TOUPPER (i)) exit(2);
 exit (0); }
 
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5343: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:5344: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   :
 else
@@ -5363,12 +5364,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for ssize_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5367: checking for ssize_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5368: checking for ssize_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_ssize_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5372 "configure"
+#line 5373 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5397,9 +5398,9 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for in_addr_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5401: checking for in_addr_t" >&5
+echo "configure:5402: checking for in_addr_t" >&5
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5403 "configure"
+#line 5404 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -5413,7 +5414,7 @@ int main() {
 in_addr_t foo;
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5417: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5418: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
 #define HAVE_IN_ADDR_T 1
@@ -5429,16 +5430,16 @@ fi
 rm -f conftest*
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether struct ip_mreq is in netinet/in.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5433: checking whether struct ip_mreq is in netinet/in.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5434: checking whether struct ip_mreq is in netinet/in.h" >&5
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5435 "configure"
+#line 5436 "configure"

 ; return 0; }
 EOF

+if { (eval echo configure:5443: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
 #define HAVE_STRUCT_IP_MREQ 1
@@ -5454,16 +5455,16 @@ fi
 rm -f conftest*
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether struct sockaddr_in6 is in netinet/in.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5458: checking whether struct sockaddr_in6 is in netinet/in.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5459: checking whether struct sockaddr_in6 is in netinet/in.h" >&5
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5460 "configure"
+#line 5461 "configure"

 ; return 0; }
 EOF

+if { (eval echo configure:5468: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
 #define HAVE_INET6 1
@@ -5479,17 +5480,17 @@ fi

-echo "configure:5483: checking for socklen_t in sys/socket.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5484: checking for socklen_t in sys/socket.h" >&5
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5485 "configure"

 ; return 0; }
 EOF

   rm -rf conftest*
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF

@@ -5505,16 +5506,16 @@ fi

 echo $ac_n "checking for tm_gmtoff in struct tm""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5509: checking for tm_gmtoff in struct tm" >&5
+echo "configure:5510: checking for tm_gmtoff in struct tm" >&5
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5511 "configure"
+#line 5512 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <time.h>
 int main() {
 struct tm tim; tim.tm_gmtoff = 0;
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5518: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5519: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
 #define STRUCT_TM_HAS_GMTOFF 1
@@ -5527,16 +5528,16 @@ else
   rm -rf conftest*
   echo "$ac_t""no" 1>&6
    echo $ac_n "checking for global timezone variable""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5531: checking for global timezone variable" >&5
+echo "configure:5532: checking for global timezone variable" >&5
             cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5533 "configure"
+#line 5534 "configure"

 #include <time.h>
 int main() {
 long z2 = timezone;
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5540: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5541: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
 #define HAVE_TIMEZONE 1
@@ -5556,19 +5557,19 @@ rm -f conftest*
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5560: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:5561: checking for working alloca.h" >&5

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF

 EOF

   rm -rf conftest*

 else

 fi

 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then

 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5598 "configure"
+#line 5599 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -5622,7 +5623,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF

   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else

-#line 5663 "configure"
+#line 5664 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -5684,12 +5685,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5688: checking for $ac_func" >&5

 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5693 "configure"
+#line 5694 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -5712,7 +5713,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5716: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5717: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -5739,15 +5740,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5743: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:5744: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5751 "configure"
+#line 5752 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -5766,7 +5767,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5770: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:5771: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -5793,7 +5794,7 @@ do

 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5797: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:5798: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_PERL'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -5862,7 +5863,7 @@ fi
 # Uses ac_ vars as temps to allow command line to override cache and checks.
 # --without-x overrides everything else, but does not touch the cache.
 echo $ac_n "checking for X""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5866: checking for X" >&5
+echo "configure:5867: checking for X" >&5
 
 # Check whether --with-x or --without-x was given.
 if test "${with_x+set}" = set; then
@@ -5924,12 +5925,12 @@ if test "$ac_x_includes" = NO; then
 
   # First, try using that file with no special directory specified.
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5928 "configure"

 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:5933: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:5934: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -5998,14 +5999,14 @@ if test "$ac_x_libraries" = NO; then
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
   LIBS="-l$x_direct_test_library $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF

 #include "confdefs.h"

 ${x_direct_test_function}()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6009: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6010: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   LIBS="$ac_save_LIBS"

     case "`(uname -sr) 2>/dev/null`" in
     "SunOS 5"*)
       echo $ac_n "checking whether -R must be followed by a space""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6115: checking whether -R must be followed by a space" >&5

       ac_xsave_LIBS="$LIBS"; LIBS="$LIBS -R$x_libraries"
       cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF

 #include "confdefs.h"

 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6125: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6126: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*

@@ -6137,14 +6138,14 @@ rm -f conftest*
       else
 	LIBS="$ac_xsave_LIBS -R $x_libraries"
 	cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6141 "configure"
+#line 6142 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6148: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then

   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_R_space=yes
 else
@@ -6176,15 +6177,15 @@ rm -f conftest*
     # libraries were built with DECnet support.  And karl@cs.umb.edu says
     # the Alpha needs dnet_stub (dnet does not exist).
     echo $ac_n "checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6180: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet" >&5
+echo "configure:6181: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo dnet'_'dnet_ntoa | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

+#line 6189 "configure"

@@ -6195,7 +6196,7 @@ int main() {
 dnet_ntoa()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6199: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6200: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6217,15 +6218,15 @@ fi
 
     if test $ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa = no; then
       echo $ac_n "checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6221: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub" >&5
+echo "configure:6222: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo dnet_stub'_'dnet_ntoa | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-ldnet_stub  $LIBS"
